title: How to Make Churek (Flat Bread)

steps.headline: Sift the flour, add salt and dissolved yeast.
Put the dough on a board and knead it approximately 8-10 minutes.
steps.description: The dough should be soft and flexible.

steps.headline: Prepare it to rise.
steps.description: Shape the dough into a ball, put it back in the bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and place in a warm place to rise.

steps.headline: Leave it to rise.
steps.description: Approximately two hours later, the dough will have doubled.

steps.headline: Put the dough back on the board and knead it again for 3-5 minutes until the dough is smooth.
Flour the board and shape the finished dough into an oval.
steps.description: Flatten the dough and gently roll it with a rolling pin.

steps.headline: Lightly grease a large baking sheet with oil or cover with baking paper.
steps.description: Gently lay the dough on a baking sheet. Leave the dough for 15 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C). On the surface of the churek cut slashes using a sharp knife, spread the churek with the egg yolk and sprinkle with sesame or poppy seeds.

steps.headline: Bake the bread on the middle shelf in a hot oven for 20-25 minutes or until brown.

text: Dissolve yeast in warm water.  Sift the flour, add salt and dissolved yeast. Mix well. Put the dough on a board and knead it approximately 8-10 minutes. The dough should be soft and flexible. Prepare it to rise. Shape the dough into a ball, put it back in the bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and place in a warm place to rise. Leave it to rise. Approximately two hours later, the dough will have doubled. Put the dough back on the board and knead it again for 3-5 minutes until the dough is smooth.  Flour the board and shape the finished dough into an oval. Flatten the dough and gently roll it with a rolling pin. Lightly grease a large baking sheet with oil or cover with baking paper. Gently lay the dough on a baking sheet. Leave the dough for 15 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C). On the surface of the churek cut slashes using a sharp knife, spread the churek with the egg yolk and sprinkle with sesame or poppy seeds. Bake the bread on the middle shelf in a hot oven for 20-25 minutes or until brown. Bon appetit!
